title: Part 1
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for a correct description of the difference between civil rights and civil liberties. The response must include both of the following:

  • Civil rights protect groups from discrimination.

  • Civil liberties protect individuals from government actions.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.


1 point

One point is earned for a correct description of the difference between civil rights and civil liberties. The response must include both of the following:

  • Civil rights protect groups from discrimination.

  • Civil liberties protect individuals from government actions.

Student response earns one of the available points.

1 point

  • Civil rights protect groups from discrimination.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for a correct identification of the equal protection clause.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

1 point

One point is earned for a correct identification of the equal protection clause.

Student response earns one of the available points.

1 point

One point is earned for a correct identification of the equal protection clause.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
2 points

One point is earned for a correct description of a specific legislative action that extended civil rights to each of the following:

  • Women: right to vote; equal pay for equal work; equality in academics and athletics; laws expanding role of women in the military, etc.

  • Persons with disabilities: public accommodations; educational accommodations, etc.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

2 points

One point is earned for a correct description of a specific legislative action that extended civil rights to each of the following:

  • Women: right to vote; equal pay for equal work; equality in academics and athletics; laws expanding role of women in the military, etc.

  • Persons with disabilities: public accommodations; educational accommodations, etc.

Student response earns one of the available points.

2 points

  • Women: right to vote; equal pay for equal work; equality in academics and athletics; laws expanding role of women in the military, etc.

  • Persons with disabilities: public accommodations; educational accommodations, etc.

Student response earns two of the available points.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for a correct identification of the due process clause.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

1 point

1 point

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
2 points

One point is earned for each of two accurate explanations of how civil liberties were incorporated by the Supreme Court by the following cases:

  • Gideon v. Wainwright — right to an attorney for indigents

  • Mapp v. Ohio — illegally seized evidence cannot be used in court; exclusionary rule

  • Miranda v. Arizona— must be informed of rights: no self-incrimination; right to counsel, etc.

NOTE: The response must include reference to incorporation (i.e., application to the states or police action)

A score of zero (0) is assigned to an answer that is off-task or is attempted but earns no points.

A score of dash (—) is assigned to an answer that is blank.
